result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roberto Drake Rodriguez

defendant.name: Rodriguez, Roberto Drake
defendant.address: 2738 East Bolivar Avenue #1, Saint Francis, WI 53235

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roberto Drake Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael F. Hart in court for Roberto Drake Rodriguez.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Patrick T Franken for Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defendant waived revocation. Defense has not received offer and requested plea and sentencing date. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Michael F. Hart in court, defendant Roberto Drake Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Parties inform court that they are still in negotiations. Court adjourns matter for a Status Conference date to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 067460,
Payable Number: 1020406,
Receipt Number: 22RP028925,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Roberto Drake Rodriguez in court with Attorney Michael F. Hart; both appear by video.  Defendant Roberto Drake Rodriguez in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective A. Molina. Court took judicial notice of 13CF3917. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL ISSUES:
 Defendant Roberto Drake Rodriguez in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Roberto Drake Rodriguez in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
